creditline: Gift of Mary and Bob Mersky
markings: verso, TC white gallery label: Karl Wirsum / Gargoyle Gargle Oil, c. 1968 / mixed media and collage on paper / 40.75 x 28 inches / (Inv# KW_7759)
medium: Mixed media and collage on board
text: Have you ever heard a gargoyle gargle oil? Well, you may not have heard one do that but you have now seen one do so! Karl Wirsum loved wordplay and music and those elements are present together in this inventive rendering of a creature known for guarding cathedral corners in a recording/radio studio gargling some sort of elixir on the air. The sounds manifest as music notes and the word gAAR-rr-R-GGGOYLE which sounds like the noise a gargoyle gargling oil might make!
title: Untitled (Gaar-rr-r-gggoyle Gargle Oil),
